title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 330-1.2 - Designation of records access officers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 330-1.2 - Designation of records access officers

State Regulations
(a) The Commissioner of General Services is
responsible for insuring compliance with this Part and designates the
incumbents of the following position as records access officer: (1)

Director of Public Information
41st Floor

Tower Building

Empire State Plaza

Albany, NY 12242
(b) The records access officer is responsible
for insuring appropriate agency response to public requests for access to
records. The records access officer shall: (1)
maintain an up-to-date reasonably
detailed subject matter list of all records in the possession of the agency, whether or not such records are available to the public; (2)
maintain forms on the internet for
requesting records and responding to request for records; (3)
assist the requester in identifying
requested records, if necessary; (4)
upon locating the records, take one of
the following actions in accordance with section
330-1.5
(b) of this

Subpart: (i) acknowledge receipt of the
request; (ii)
make records promptly
available for inspection; or
(iii)
deny access to records in whole or in part, and explain in writing the reasons
therefor; (5)
upon
request for copies of records: (i) make a
copy available upon payment of established fees in accordance with section
330-1.7
of this Subpart; or
(ii)
permit the requester to
copy those records; (6)
upon request, certify to the correctness of such copy; (7)
upon failure to locate records, certify
that: (i) the Office of General Services is
not the legal custodian for such records; or
(ii)
the records of which the Office of

General Services is a legal custodian, after reasonably diligent search, cannot
be found. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
330-1.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
